alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 10:55AM MDT until June 30 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Weld. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 AM MDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. An irrigation ditch has breached, which will result in flooding along Box Elder Creek from the Adams County line northward to the confluence with the South Platte River. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Box Elder Creek and Horse Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Low lying areas along Box Elder Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
